newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Buildmax says has cash for expansion.
newsitem.headline: Buildmax says has cash for expansion.

text.p: Buildmax Ltd, a building products group, said on Tuesday the outlook for the second half of the financial year was positive and opportunities for expansion existed.

Releasing results for the six months to end September, Buildmax said there was a progressive increase in trading levels towards the end of the first six months which was continuing into the second half.
It said the group was well positioned for growth as it had been awarded a number of contracts in low-cost housing schemes, and the recent purchase of the Watson group added to its diversification.

A 33.6 million rand rights issue in October, which had given effective control of Buildmax to Malaysia's Mycom Berhad, had degeared the group leaving it with 15 million rand in cash and open to "general expansion possibilities".
Buildmax reported first half attributable rising to 2.43 million rand from 1.43 million in the comparable period last year.
